page.title: 19Marsh Linhays
page.content: A linhay is a circular stone barn for sheltering cattle. Most of the linhays are ruined and no longer in use. About 100 years ago linhays would be a common feature of the marshes. The Braunton Conservation Project is restoring one of the largest linhays to its almost original state. They have used dry stone and cement but the roof will be an imitation of the old type. At present the thatch is not on the roof but the beams are in position. When completed the linhay will provide shelter for cattle. The success of this project will determine whether other linhays are restored in future.
